title: Investigation of Carbon Products Produced by Catalytic Pyrolysis of Natural Gas
content: Catalytic pyrolysis of natural gas (NGCP), a chemical process that transforms natural gas (NG) (CH4) into hydrogen and solid carbon without a CO2 byproduct [1-3], has been proposed as a near term solution for the production of hydrogen, while proposed greener hydrogen production technologies are demonstrated and, upon being verified, allowed to mature. For NGCP to be successfully implemented, the generated carbon products need to be value added and aligned with target markets able to handle the influx that will be generated in conjunction with hydrogen. Alignment of the carbon products within certain markets entails tailoring the properties and allotropes selectivity to maximize the value-added nature of the material. A first step in tailoring to markets involves leveraging analytical techniques and creating methods to characterize the carbon products. [4].
